Modules

app.create_app()[source]
database.callback(code)[source]
database.create_user(first_name, last_name, email, password)[source]

Create a user in the database

Args: first_name (str): The first name of the user. last_name (str): The last name of the user. email (str): The email address of the user. password (str): The user’s password (hashed before storage).

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • dict: The created user data (if successful).

  • int: HTTP status code (201 for success, 400 for errors, 500 for server errors).

Return type:

tuple

Raises:

Exception – If there is an issue with database insertion.

database.generate_code_challenge(verifier)[source]

Create a SHA256 challenge from the code verifier (RFC 7636).

database.generate_code_verifier()[source]

Generate a secure random code verifier (43-128 characters).

database.get_all_logs()[source]

Retrieves all logs stored in the ‘Logs’ table.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing all logs.

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error fetching the logs from the database.

database.get_logs_by_user(user_id)[source]

Retrieves all logs associated with a specific user.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – The ID of the user whose logs are to be fetched.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing logs for the specified user.

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error fetching logs for the user.

database.get_supabase() → SyncClient[source]
database.get_user_by_id(user_id)[source]

Fetch a single user by ID.

Parameters:

user_id (str) – The unique identifier of the user.

Returns:

A dictionary containing user details if found. None: If the user does not exist.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error during the database query.

database.log_event(event)[source]

Logs an event by inserting it into the ‘Logs’ table in the database.

Parameters:

event (dict) – A dictionary containing event details. Expected keys are: - ‘event’: The name of the event. - ‘time_lapse’: A textual description of the event. - ‘metadata’: Additional data associated with the event.

Raises:

Exception – If there is an error inserting the log into the database.
